CatDescriptText: Joan Horsmone, student, Level Green and Fay Hillman, student, Warrendale, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 19, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you approve of teachers paddling children?"  Ms. Horsmone's answer reads: "Yes, I do, as long as it isn't me.  If the child gets out of hand, then paddling should be used."  Ms. Hillman's answer reads: "HIgh school kids should not be beaten.  At that age, the teacher should be able to explain to the student just what the correct action should be.  For the children in grades one to five, paddling should be alright.  But in junior and senior high schools, there should be no paddling."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Joan Horsmone wearing plaid coat with fur collar, standing in front of lighting store; Portrait of Fay Hillman wearing head scarf and coat with fur collar, standing in front of lighting store
